summary: This document is an email chain from September 19, 2008, regarding a journalist's inquiry about the federal non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein. A staff writer from the Palm Beach Daily News is seeking comment from the U.S. Attorney's Office on why they decided not to prosecute Epstein, referencing the AUSA who handled the case.

persons.name: Michele Dargan
persons.context: Journalist from the Palm Beach Daily News working on a deadline story about the federal non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, seeking comment from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the journalist's inquiry regarding his federal non-prosecution agreement and state plea agreement.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry on Epstein Non-Prosecution
events.description: Michele Dargan, a staff writer for the Palm Beach Daily News, contacts the U.S. Attorney's Office seeking comment on why they decided not to prosecute Jeffrey Epstein federally, referencing the non-prosecution agreement tied to his state plea.

keyFacts: A journalist is inquiring about the federal non-prosecution agreement for Jeffrey Epstein, which was part of his state plea agreement.
The inquiry highlights that Epstein could still be federally prosecuted if he violated any portion of his state agreement.
The email indicates the U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing to respond with 'no comment' unless instructed otherwise about public record information.
